Detailed Description

\class CEvent Encapsulates event handling. Events consist of an event monitor which is responsible for determining when an event fires and a reactor which provides application specific handling of the event. When enabled, the event will schedule a thread m_EventThread to process the event. The event thread contains code to repeatedly calll the monitor's operator(), lock the global mutex and call the reactor's operator(). The reactors provided with classes derived from this are generally standardized to invoke Subclass virtual function which are specific to the event being managed..
